revised_title: Spectroscopic Observations of Orion Nebula and Jupiter
tldr: The author examines the Orion Nebula and Jupiter using the Great Melbourne Telescope and spectroscopy, discovering that the nebulosity within and around the trapezium in the Orion Nebula is comparable in brightness to the surrounding nebula. They also observe spectral lines in Jupiter's atmosphere, suggesting that the lines may be due to the planet's own atmosphere.
